intro: Geissanthus mameicillo, commonly known as the Mameicillo plant, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae, characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or humid conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are pollinated primarily by hummingbirds, making it an important part of local ecosystems.
